abstract: Sprint Nextel reports third-quarter loss of $301 million, or 10 cents per share, down from loss of $911 million, or 30 cents per share, in year-ago quarter; revenue was $8.3 billion, up 2.2 percent.
snippet: The third-largest wireless carrier said it was doing better at keeping and attracting subscribers, as it reported its smallest quarterly loss in four years.
lead_paragraph: The third-largest wireless carrier said it was doing better at keeping and attracting subscribers, as it reported its smallest quarterly loss in four years.

headline.main: Sprint Reports Smaller Loss and a Gain in Subscribers
headline.print_headline: Sprint Reports Smaller Loss And a Gain in Subscribers
headline.seo: Sprint Nextel’s Losses Narrow as It Gains Subscribers
